stories.text:
Hi HN folks,

I was browsing Aaron's blog [http://www.aaronsw.com/weblog/rawnerve] when I noticed the footer links out to http://theinfo.org/ (last updated March 2008). However, none of the links are still alive, and I couldn't find any pages that were backed up on Archive.org.

I figured this would be the best place to ask - does anyone have an archive of these pages?
stories.title: Ask HN: Does anyone have a backup of Aaron Swartz' site: theinfo.org?
Dishonest and Contradictory: Fact-Checking CSIROâ€™s Communications about the Tru

stories.text: I'm just curious to know how do you see a 10+ years of experience designer moving to Product manager role. Is it organic or radically different. What options do you best see a UX designer to grow into.
stories.title: Ask HN: How do you see a senior UX Designer going into Product Manager role?
Fly an epic airplane constructed out of grocery items

stories.text:
I'm wondering if HN has thoughts on how to format URLs printed on paper, and whether you think its necessary to differentiate them from surrounding text.

Examples of formatting: blue color, underline, and I guess also whether you include the protocol or www.

Finally, does the context (resume, wedding invite, advertisement) matter?
stories.title: Ask HN: How do you format URLs that are printed on paper?
Rally Interactive design agency joining Stripe
Sony Playstation SVP caught in pedophile sting video
Self-propelled magnetic nanobot for efficient capture of circulating tumor cells
